item.title: UK will back words with actions against Houthis in Yemen - Cameron
item.description: The foreign secretary says the air strikes were necessary after Houthis attacks on ships in the Red Sea.

item.title: Six held over plot to disrupt London Stock Exchange
item.description: Police said the arrests were made in London, Liverpool and Brighton over a "disruptive and damaging stunt".

item.title: Sealed with a kiss: Frederik X becomes King of Denmark
item.description: The new monarch blinks back tears as he greets the cheering crowds outside Christiansborg Castle.

item.title: Iceland volcano eruption spills lava into town setting houses on fire
item.description: The entire population of Grindavik has been evacuated as an expert warns of a "worst-case scenario" unfolding.

item.title: Iran frees Niloufar Hamedi and Elaheh Mohammadi, jailed for covering Mahsa Amini death
item.description: Niloufar Hamedi and Elaheh Mohammadi spent more than a year in prison on charges of colluding the US.

item.title: Holly Willoughby back on TV screens in Dancing on Ice
item.description: The presenter has been absent from TV screens since October, after leaving This Morning.

item.title: Iowa caucus: Trump counts on evangelicals to carry him to victory
item.description: In the 2016 caucus, religious voters in the state stayed away from Donald Trump. They've since become a vital part of his base.

item.title: Five migrants die trying to cross English Channel in boat
item.description: A small boat carrying dozens of people overturned just off the French coast south of Calais.

item.title: Thousands call for release of hostages at pro-Israel rally in London
item.description: People gathered in Trafalgar Square carrying Israeli flags and pictures of those being held in Gaza.

item.title: Hezbollah missile attack kills Israeli woman and son
item.description: A woman in her seventies and her son have been killed by an anti-tank missile attack on northern Israel.

item.title: Rare white penguin filmed in Antarctica
item.description: A penguin with leucism from the Gentoo species has been filmed in the icy climate in early January.

item.title: Masters 2024: Ronnie O'Sullivan fights back to beat Ali Carter 10-7 for eighth title
item.description: Ronnie O'Sullivan fights back to claim a record-extending eighth Masters title with a thrilling 10-7 victory over Ali Carter at a raucous Alexandra Palace.

item.title: David Cameron denies Â£10m payment from Greensill Capital
item.description: The foreign secretary says he was a "private citizen" while working for the collapsed finance firm.

item.title: Oppenheimer: Cillian Murphy film marches towards Oscars success
item.description: Christopher Nolan's film got another boost in its awards campaign at last week's Golden Globes.

item.title: King Frederik: Tens of thousands turn out for succession
item.description: King Frederik becomes the new monarch of Denmark, following Queen Margarethe's abdication.

item.title: 100 days since Hamas attacked Israel, triggering war in Gaza
item.description: Thousands of Israelis gathered in Tel Aviv to mark 100 days since the start of the unprecedented war against Hamas.

item.title: TB Joshua exposÃ©: How the disgraced pastor faked his miracles
item.description: Six ways the late megachurch pastor conned millions of people to believe in his purported cures.

item.title: Fujitsu Japan remains tight-lipped on the Post Office scandal
item.description: In Fujitsu's home market, hardly anyone had heard of the Horizon scandal until this week.

item.title: Tom Walker: 'I lost my way with music'
item.description: The Scottish star's debut album sold three million copies worldwide. Following it up proved harder.

item.title: Boeing's mid-air blowout puts safety record in spotlight again
item.description: After a door plug blew off one of its planes, questions are being asked about how seriously Boeing undertakes safety.

item.title: Agatha Christie: The Indian hotel murder that inspired the queen of crime
item.description: The sensational case, which made global headlines, is said to have influenced Christie's first book.

item.title: Queen Margrethe: Will abdication cause a ripple effect?
item.description: Nordic monarchies are known to embrace modernity. Abdication was one of the few customs they resisted - until now.

item.title: Talk of Trump dominates as Iowa voters kick off 2024 race
item.description: As Republican candidates make their final pitches, Donald Trump is on the minds of both his supporters and opponents.

item.title: Brrrr! Your pictures on the theme of 'in the cold'
item.description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

item.title: Gabriel Attal: Youngest French PM hopes to revive Macron's government
item.description: France's youngest PM is already popular with the public but how long will the honeymoon period last?

item.title: Tough choices for Israel in US's Middle East vision
item.description: The US plan sees diplomatic normalisation with Arab neighbours if Israel ends its offensive.

item.title: Brunei: Asia's most eligible prince formally marries in 10-day celebration
item.description: Prince Abdul Mateen waves at well-wishers from an open-top Rolls Royce as he weds Yang Mulia Anisha Rosnah.

item.title: Taiwan election: China says US 'gravely wrong' to congratulate new leader
item.description: Beijing accuses the US of violating its commitment to maintain only unofficial ties with Taiwan.

item.title: William Lai: Taiwan just chose a president China loathes. What now?
item.description: How William Lai manages Beijing, and how Beijing reacts to him, will determine his presidency.

item.title: Iceland volcano lava sets house on fire in Iceland
item.description: The last residents of Grindavik were evacuated around 03:00 GMT on Sunday morning.

item.title: BBC's Glenn Campbell on shock of brain cancer diagnosis
item.description: BBC Scotland's political editor says the discovery of a tumour was devastating - but that he's been lucky.

item.title: UK weather: Bitter Arctic winds to bring snow to UK this week
item.description: Temperatures are set to plunge across large parts of the UK with snow and ice warnings issued.

item.title: Bolton Wanderers fan Iain Purslow dies after suspected cardiac arrest at Cheltenham Town game
item.description: Bolton supporter Iain Purslow dies after suffering a suspected cardiac arrest during their home game against Cheltenham.

item.title: Straw bear burned in festival ceremony
item.description: Thousands of people attend the three-day festival which ends with the burning of a bear effigy.

item.title: Elizabeth line trial to cover platform 'ghost' marks
item.description: Trials are being carried out to cover marks on platform walls caused by Elizabeth line passengers.

item.title: NUFC footballer Joelinton's home broken into
item.description: Police are called out to reports of three men inside the house in Northumberland.

item.title: Dog stolen from Newark found 200 miles away after appeal
item.description: The charity which helped track down the missing German Shepherd say his owners are "over the moon".

item.title: 'I had Â£3,000 stolen via WhatsApp job scam message'
item.description: There's been a huge rise in the amount of money being stolen via recruitment scam text and WhatsApp messages.

item.title: Awaab's Law: Rochdale mouldy homes tenants 'told they breathed too much'
item.description: Tenants share experiences of mouldy homes as ministers propose a new law in memory of Awaab Ishak.

item.title: What are cold weather payments and how much are they worth?
item.description: Cold weather payments are available to some people after seven days of below-zero temperatures.

item.title: 'We need jungle' - Amol Rajan on how a University Challenge question spawned a remix craze
item.description: The University Challenge host on how one question went viral and inspired the jungle music community.

item.title: Post Office may face Â£100m tax bill over victim payouts - experts
item.description: It may have underpaid more than Â£100m in tax while overpaying its senior executives, according to experts.

item.title: Huge fire rips through warehouse in Russia
item.description: Hundreds of firefighters battled to put out the blaze at the Wildberries warehouse in St Petersburg.

item.title: Sir Jim Ratcliffe: What issues need addressing at Man Utd?
item.description: Sir Jim Ratcliffe got a first look at his Â£1.25bn investment as Manchester United drew 2-2 with Tottenham on Sunday. But what issues need to be addressed at Old Trafford?

item.title: Australian Open 2024: Andy Murray plays Tomas Martin Etcheverry, Naomi Osaka makes Melbourne return
item.description: Andy Murray is aiming for a quicker victory when he starts his Australian Open campaign against Argentina's Tomas Martin Etcheverry.

item.title: Afcon 2023: Egypt 2-2 Mozambique - Mohamed Salah salvages draw with late penalty
item.description: Mohamed Salah scores an injury-time penalty to salvage a draw for Egypt against Mozambique at the 2023 Africa Cup of Nations.

item.title: NFL play-offs: Green Bay Packers stun Dallas Cowboys with 48-32 road win
item.description: The Green Bay Packers pull off the first shock of this season's NFL play-offs as they claim a stunning 48-32 win at the Dallas Cowboys.

item.title: Owen Farrell: Racing 92 coach Stuart Lancaster confirms interest in signing Saracens fly-half
item.description: Racing 92 head coach Stuart Lancaster confirms his interest in signing Saracens and England fly-half Owen Farrell.

item.title: Everton boss Sean Dyche unaware of possible new financial charges
item.description: Sean Dyche says he is unaware if Everton are facing any charges regarding profit and sustainability rules relating to accounts submitted last month.

item.title: Strikes on Houthi targets in Yemen show war in Gaza has already spread
item.description: War spreading in the Middle East is not just a risk - it has already happened, writes the BBC's international editor.

item.title: What we know about strikes on Houthis and strategy behind them
item.description: Everything we know about how and why the US and UK attacked targets in Yemen.

item.title: Oil prices rise on US-UK strikes over Red Sea attacks
item.description: The UK government has drawn up scenarios suggesting further disruption could hit the economy.

item.title: Watch: Fighter jets strike targets in Yemen
item.description: Footage from UK and US authorities shows jets launch from Cyprus and a Red Sea carrier.

item.title: Chris Mason: Landmark moment for Sunak with Yemen strikes
item.description: The PM will face questions about the aim of military action in Yemen, our political editor writes.

item.title: Who are the Houthis and why are they attacking Red Sea ships?
item.description: The Houthis in Yemen have vowed to attack all ships in the Red Sea bound for Israel.

item.title: Strikes on Houthis are self-defence, says PM
item.description: Rishi Sunak says the action against the Iranian-backed group is "necessary and proportionate".
